text.p: Epitope Inc said Tuesday SmithKline Beecham PLC will make an equity investment in the developer of medical diagnostic products by buying about 200,000 shares of its common stock at the closing price of Epitope's shares on July 25.
"This equity investment will allow SmithKline Beecham to participate in the promising future we see for Epitope," said Donna Sturgess, director of diagnostic products for SB Consumer Healthcare.

"Although we have decided that the size of the over-the-counter market for OraSure does not fit SB's product profile, we still believe strongly in the technology and the company that developed it," she said.

The OraSure testing system was okayed for use by New York doctors in January 1997, A study published in the Journal of American Medical Association showed the test to be an accurate alternative to blood testing.
